intro: Neomezia cubensis subsp. oligospinosa, commonly known as the Cuban spiny acanthus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spiny leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and ravines. Its subspecies status highlights its unique adaptations to the Cuban ecosystem. It is valued for both its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
